Bill de hOra wrote:
> 
> 
> 
> LINK suffers from a problem - it magically pops into existence as a
> header, but without a means to manage the implied relationship.

I'm not understanding what you mean by this.

> I think
> the architecture simply doesn't support management of resource
> relationships in this way, and the only means is through hypertext and
> constrained protocols on top of HTTP.
> 

In some cases I can see that the data-format is inflexible (an old 
company document schema that doesn't support links) and the only way 
you'd be able to transfer relationships is through an envelope (atom) or 
headers (this proposal).  I think Atom is great for what it is built for 
(syndication), but I'm not convinced it is a good format for web 
services.  The way people are suggesting to use it in a web services 
environment is *way* to much like SOAP.  Especially in this case, where 
headers would work just fine.
